Class ButtonController

java.lang.Object
  com.viaoa.hub.HubListenerAdapter
      com.viaoa.jfc.control.JFCController
          com.viaoa.jfc.control.ButtonController
All Implemented Interfaces:
HubListener, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener
public class ButtonController
extends JFCController
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener

Functionality for binding JButton to OA.

Author:
vvia

ButtonController

                        javax.swing.AbstractButton button)
Used to bind an AbstractButton to a Hub.

Note: setAnyTime(false) is used.

setMasterControl

public void setMasterControl(boolean b)
If the hub for this command has a masterHub, then it can control this button if this is set to true. Default = true

getMasterControl

public boolean getMasterControl()

getManual

public boolean getManual()
If false (default) then command will be ran when button is pressed, else if true then no code will run when button is pressed. The button will be enabled based on status of Hub and value of command.

setManual

public void setManual(boolean b)
If false (default) then command will be ran when button is pressed, else if true then no code will run when button is pressed. The button will be enabled based on status of Hub and value of command.

setAnyTime

public void setAnyTime(boolean b)
If true and Hub is valid, then button will always be enabled, else button will be disabled based on value of command. If true and command is NEW, then button will be disabled if object needs to be saved.

Note: default value is true.

getAnyTime

public boolean getAnyTime()
If true and Hub is valid, then button will always be enabled, else button will be disabled based on value of command.

update

protected void update()
Description copied from class: JFCController
Called to have component update itself. By default, should call updateEnabled, updateVisible Most subclasses will then call update(comp, value) to update component icon/colors/font,etc

Overrides:
update in class JFCController
